explains: adj. 神秘的；神秘主义的

sentences.en: That was clearly a deep mystical experience.
sentences.cn: 那显然是一次刻骨铭心的神秘经历。

sentences.en: As a clergyman's son he'd imbibed a set of mystical beliefs from the cradle.
sentences.cn: 作为牧师之子，他从襁褓时就耳濡目染并接受了一套神秘信仰。

sentences.en: Watching the sun rise over the mountain was an almost mystical experience.
sentences.cn: 看着太阳爬上山冈，这几乎是一种难以言传的体验。
